snippet: Court documents shed light on Yahoo’s unsuccessful challenge of federal requests for warrantless surveillance of its foreign users.
abstract: Court documents show that federal government threatened Yahoo in 2008 with fines of $250,000 a day if company did not immediately comply with secret court order to turn over data about its foreign customers; threat adds new details to public history of Yahoo's unsuccessful challenge of federal requests for warrantless surveillance of its foreigner users.

byline.original: By VINDU GOEL and CHARLIE SAVAGE

lead_paragraph: Court documents shed light on Yahoo’s unsuccessful challenge of federal requests for warrantless surveillance of its foreign users.

headline.main: Government’s Threat of Daily Fine for Yahoo Shows Aggressive Push for Data
headline.print_headline: Threat of Daily Fine Shows Government’s Aggressive Push for Data
